origin.origPlace: Fundort: Oxyrynchites, Egypt oder Herakleopolites, Egypt; Schreibort: Egypt

encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: General - Some other minor changes in the text.
General - Some other minor changes in the text.

General - fr. A, column 2, l. 2 <:σοφησ̣[.?]=Vassallo > <:σοφησ̣[.?] // fr. A, column 2, l. 3 <:κακω[.?]=Vassallo > <:κακω[.?] // fr. A, column 2, l. 5 <:να.2[.?]=Vassallo > <:να.2[.?] // fr. A, column 2, l. 8 <:πο̣λε[.?]=Vassallo > <:πο̣λε[.?] // fr. A, column 2, l. 10 <:ο̣υντ̣[.?]=Vassallo > <:ο̣υντ̣[.?] // There were Commentary entries like "Vassallo registered unedited readings by Uebel", then the greek text by Uebel: I have deleted them, since his readings have been at the end included in the apparatus // fr. B, l. 7 [.?] τ̣ης· > [.?]τ̣ης· // fr. B, l. 13 [.?] των > [.?]των // Deleted Illustrations, Online Resources (link not working anymore) http://papyri.dl.uni-leipzig.de/servlets/MCRQueryServlet?mode=ObjectMetadata&status=2&type=schrift&layout=simple&hosts=local&lang=DE&query=/mycoreobject%5B@ID='IAwJPapyri_schrift_00280'%5D // General Notes: replaced previous "The measurements of fragment B are cm 6,4x9,5" with "Measurements of fragment A are cm 6,4x9,5, fragment B cm 5,6x13. The original of fr. A bis is lost, only Uebel's transcription survives" // Provenance: added Herakleopolites, Egypt

General - fr. A, column 2, l. 2 <:σοφησ̣[.?]=Vassallo > <:σοφησ̣[.?] // fr. A, column 2, l. 3 <:κακω[.?]=Vassallo > <:κακω[.?] // fr. A, column 2, l. 5 <:να.2[.?]=Vassallo > <:να.2[.?] // fr. A, column 2, l. 8 <:πο̣λε[.?]=Vassallo > <:πο̣λε[.?] // fr. A, column 2, l. 10 <:ο̣υντ̣[.?]=Vassallo > <:ο̣υντ̣[.?] // There were Commentary entries like "Vassallo registered unedited readings by Uebel", then the greek text by Uebel: I have deleted them, since his readings have been at the end included in the apparatus // fr. B, l. 7 [.?] τ̣ης· > [.?]τ̣ης· // fr. B, l. 13 [.?] των > [.?]των // Deleted Illustrations, Online Resources (link not working anymore) http://papyri.dl.uni-leipzig.de/servlets/MCRQueryServlet?mode=ObjectMetadata&status=2&type=schrift&layout=simple&hosts=local&lang=DE&query=/mycoreobject%5B@ID='IAwJPapyri_schrift_00280'%5D // General Notes: replaced previous "The measurements of fragment B are cm 6,4x9,5" with "Measurements of fragment A are cm 6,4x9,5, fragment B cm 5,6x13. The original of fr. A bis is lost, only Uebel's transcription survives" // Provenance: added Herakleopolites, Egypt

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - fr. A <D=.1.column <= > <D=.1.column<= (deleted extra-space between column and <=) fr. A, column 1, l. 5 <:καρα 6.- [.?]|ed|καρα 6.- [δοκ] [.?] > <:καρα6.- [.?]|ed|καρα6.- [δοκ] [.?] (deleted extra-spaces afer καρα) fr. A, column 1, l. 7 ἔ̣λ̣εγες > <:ἔ̣λ̣εγες||ed||ἔ̣λεγες=primum legit Uebel (in his unpublished transciption of the papyrus)|[ἔ]λ̣εγες=Spinelli:> Since in the apparatus there are several references to Uebel's unpublished work on the papyrus that cannot be added as bibliography in papyri.info, I would add in the Commentary for l. 7 (the first place where Uebel's name is found): Ueber in the apparatus refers to his two unpublished transcriptions of the papyrus (Uebel, a corresponds to a first draft; Uebel, b to a second draft) that have been found by Christian Vassallo in the Archive of the Papyrussammlung of the Friedrich-Schiller-Universität, Jena. fr. A, column 1, l. 8 ed|[.?] .1ω̣τερο̣ν=Spinelli:> > ed|[.?].1ω̣τερο̣ν=Spinelli:> (deletes space between [.?] and .1) fr. A, column 1, l. 9 [.?]ε̣τρυ > <:[.?]ε̣τρυ||ed||[.?]ετρυ=Uebel, b (ετρου, Uebel, a)|[.?].1τρυ=Spinelli|πρυ10.- [τανεῖον][.?]=Luppe. perp. apud Spinelli:> (added apparatus) fr. A, column 1, l. 10 [.?] <:τ̣ου|ed|[τού]του vel [αὐ]τοῦ > <:[.?]τ̣ου|ed|[.?][τού]του vel [.?][αὐ]τοῦ (I have included [.?] in the ed tag) fr. A, column 1, l. 11 [.?]<:νγ̣ενοι|ed|[συ]γγένοι 12.- [το] > <:[.?]νγ̣ενοι|ed|[.?][συ]γγένοι12.- [το][.?] (I have included [.?] in the ed tag; deleted extra-space before 12.-; added [.?] after [το]) fr. A, column 1, l. 12 [.?]<:νος||ed||[ἐκεῖ]νος|[.?] νοι=Spinelli:> > <:[.?]νος||ed||[.?][ἐκεῖ]νος|[.?]νοι=Spinelli:> (I have included [.?] in the ed tag; added a [.?] before [ἐκεῖ]νος; deleted extra-space before νοι) fr. A, column 1, 13 [.?]<:ξ̣ων||ed||[.?] [δ]ο̣ξ̣ῶν=legerit ac suppleverit e.g. Vassallo| [.?] δ̣ων̣=Spinelli:> > <:[.?]ξ̣ων||ed||[.?][δ]ο̣ξ̣ῶν=legerit ac suppleverit e.g. Vassallo|[.?]δ̣ων̣=Spinelli:> (I have included [.?] in the ed tag; deleted some extra-spaces) fr. A, column 1, 14 [.?]<:.ε̣ις̣|ed|[.?] [πό]λ̣ε̣ις > <:[.?].1ε̣ις̣|ed|[.?][πό]λ̣ε̣ις (I have included [.?] in the ed tag; changed . in .1; deleted extra-space before [πό]λ̣ε̣ις) fr. A, column 1, 15 [.?]λ̣ω. > [.?]λ̣ω.1 fr. A, column 1, 18 vac.3 > vac.2-3 fr. A <D=.2.column <= > <D=.2.column<= (deleted extra-space before <=) fr. A, column 2, 1 I would add in the Commentary: δε seems to have been corrected over a previous letter, perhaps omicron fr. A, column 2, 1 <:ουκ̣=Vassallo|ed|οὐ μ̣=Spinelli:> [.?] > <:ουκ̣[.?]=Vassallo|ed|οὐ μ̣[.?]=Spinelli:> fr. A, column 2, 2 <:σοφησ̣[.?]=Vassallo|ed|[φιλο] 1.- σοφῆσ̣[αι] vel [φιλο] 1.- σοφήσ̣[ας] vel σοφῆς̣ et sim.=suppleverit e.g. Vassallo|:> > <:σοφησ̣[.?]=Vassallo||ed||[.?][φιλο]2.- σοφῆσ̣[αι][.?] vel [.?][φιλο]2.- σοφήσ̣[ας][.?] vel σοφῆς̣[.?] et sim.=suppleverit e.g. Vassallo|[.?][φιλο].2- σοφη[.?]=iam Uebel, a, dubit.:> (1.- changed in 2.-; deleted extra-spaces; added various [.?]) fr. A, column 2, 5 <:να.2[.?]=Vassallo|ed|ναι̣ε̣[.?]=leg. Messeri per litt., fortasse et ναρε:> > <:να.2[.?]=Vassallo||ed||ναι̣ε̣[.?]=leg. Messeri per litt.|fortasse et ναρε=Vassallo:> fr. Uebel, a, dubit.|[κ]αὶ πολ[λοὶ] (etiam πολ[ιτ][ca.2]) fr. B, l. 8 [.?] <:[σ]ι̣γάζε̣ται=legit ac suppl. Vassallo|ed|[ἐ]ργάζεται=Uebel, Messeri per litt.:> > <:[.?][σ]ι̣γάζε̣ται=legit ac suppl. Vassallo|ed|[.?][ἐ]ρ̣γάζεται=Uebel, b, Messeri per litt.:> fr. B, l. 8 μάλισ[τα] > μάλι̣σ̣[τα] fr. B, l. 9 \τε/ > <:\τε/||ed||\.1ε/=Uebel, b|\.2/=Spinelli:> fr. div.p: This papyrus has been digitally edited by Marco Collatuzzo during a workshop organized at the University of Florence by Valeria Piano (Univ. of Florence) with James Cowey (instructor; Univ. of Heidelberg) and Claudio Vergara (assistant; Univ. of Naples Federico II) within the project PRIN2022-INTEGRATION. INTEllectual miGRATION: circulation of philosophical books and ideas around the ancient Mediterranean through the evidence of Graeco-Roman papyri (CUP: B53D23023140006; P.I. Valeria Piano)

div.head: Column 1
div.ab:
χαλεποίποι εἰσιν
αις τὰ του
.ωσιν προ
ἔλυσενἔλυσον ωι
τα καρα
καρα
δοκ ὦὦ Σώκρατες,
σὺσὺ ἔλεγεςἔλεγεςἔλεγες
νεώτερον ωτερον
ετρυετρυτρυπρυ
τανεῖον
τουτούτου vel αὐτοῦ τε καὶ
νγενοισυγγένοι
το
νοςἐκεῖνοςνοι φύγοι
ξωνδοξῶνδων ἀλλὰ

μουσικ
σ

div.head: Column 2
div.ab:
δε ουκοὐ μ
σοφησφιλο
σοφῆσαι vel φιλο
σοφήσας vel σοφῆς et sim.φιλο
σοφη
κακωκακῶς vel κακῶν
αγαθαγαθ
ναναιεfortasse et ναρε

div.head: Fragment B
div.ab:

item.p: "Ueber, a" and "Ueber, b" in the apparatus refer to Uebel's two unpublished transcriptions of the papyrus (a = first draft; b = second draft) that have been found by Christian Vassallo in the Archive of the Papyrussammlung of the Friedrich-Schiller-Universität, Jena.

div.p: Measurements of fragment A are cm 6,4x9,5, fragment B cm 5,6x13. The original of fr. A bis is lost, only Uebel's transcription survives.
